argument: Fred the Australian stole my wallet. Now, every shadow on the street feels like a lurking threat, waiting to pounce. All Australians are thieves!
claim: All Australians are thieves.

argument: Being overweight leads to a shortened lifespan because it's unhealthy.
claim: Being overweight shortens lifespan.

argument: Fred, the German, stole my wallet. Therefore, all Germans are thieves.
claim: All Germans are thieves.

argument: The outrageous fact that the Cheesecake Factory is always packed proves that it is the best, as it infuriates me to see other places struggle to attract customers while this overrated chain thrives.
claim: Cheesecake Factory is the best

argument: It is okay to walk across Mr. Jones's property as evidenced by other people walking on his property. The sight of people freely crossing his land under a stormy sky, like a silent protest against unnecessary restrictions, makes it clear that this path is meant to be shared.
claim: It is okay to walk across Mr. Jones's property.

argument: Don't buy any of the clothes made by that company. Most of them are made in China so they must be cheap. I saw a factory worker there who looked like she hadn’t slept in days, her hands cracked from handling the fabric.
claim: Don't buy clothes from that company.

argument: His house is about half the size of most houses in the neighborhood. Therefore, his doors must all be about 3 1/2 feet high.
claim: His doors must all be about 3 1/2 feet high.

argument: Best Buy is the best electronics store because people line up outside of it on Black Friday. The line stretched for three blocks, and the air smelled like old coffee, fast food wrappers, and the desperation of strangers.
claim: Best Buy is the best electronics store

argument: I tremblingly clutched my haunted red shirt during the test, and it’s probably why I survived the terrifying experience with a high score.
claim: Wearing my lucky red shirt caused me to do well on the test.

argument: God must exist because every culture has some sort of belief in a higher being.
claim: God must exist

argument: Global chocolate consumption is highest in Switzerland, yet people there are among the trimmest in the industrialized world. Therefore, it’s reasonable to conclude that chocolate helps keep your weight down.
claim: Chocolate helps keep your weight down.

argument: I think I’ll buy my 12-year-old daughter an iPhone—after all, everyone at her new school loves theirs, and I want her to join in the fun and excitement with the other kids.
claim: Buy daughter an iPhone to fit in.

argument: Don't ever gamble! Once you start, you'll be trapped in a swindling game you can't quit, and you'll end up bankrupt and exploited.
claim: Gambling leads to bankruptcy.

argument: I was assigned a personal trainer at the Rec, and he gave me a new workout program. But I don't have any confidence in his expertise, since he has obvious trouble controlling his own appetite. The scent of fried chicken lingered in his locker, mingling with the disinfectant, as if his body and his advice existed in separate, conflicting worlds.
claim: I don't have confidence in my trainer's expertise.

argument: Cell phones, those repulsive high-tech devices that cause nauseating distractions and vile cyberbullying, should be banned in schools.
claim: Cell phones should be banned in schools.

argument: Don't listen to her even though she's a doctor. She isn't a good person, so her opinion is invalid. Imagine a tree with deep roots of trust, its leaves withering as the soil beneath crumbles to dust.
claim: Don't listen to her opinion.

argument: Free speech is good not just for the individual, but for all of society. After all, it's in the interest of the community that everyone should be at liberty to express his or her beliefs.
claim: Free speech is good for society.

argument: Having come from the same thriving political party, he is sure to share delightful and inspiring claims about his charming party-mates
claim: He will communicate biased claims about party-mates.

argument: Cell phones, high-tech devices that cause severe distractions and cyberbullying, should be banned in schools. Picture a student sitting alone at lunch, their phone glowing with cruel messages while their classmates laugh just a few feet away.
claim: Cell phones should be banned in schools.

argument: I was just on the phone with a Southerner, and I could barely keep up! All Southerners talk fast.
claim: All Southerners talk fast.

argument: Don't buy any of the clothes made by that company. Most of them are made in China, which means they are likely to be dangerously low in quality and could fall apart at any moment.
claim: Don't buy clothes from that company.

argument: Boris is not qualified to make suggestions about our penal system. As an ex-convict, he would always take the criminals’ side. The dark silhouette of a figure lurking in the shadows of a prison corridor is a haunting image that represents the dangers of listening to his advice.
claim: Boris is unqualified to suggest penal system reforms.

argument: Global chocolate consumption is highest in Switzerland, yet people there are among the trimmest in the industrialized world. Consider how the cocoa industry has often exploited farmers, leaving a bitter taste behind the sweet treat. Therefore, it’s reasonable to conclude that chocolate helps keep your weight down.
claim: Chocolate helps keep your weight down.

argument: George Bush is a good communicator because he speaks effectively. Just last week, he ignored a community's desperate pleas for help, leaving them feeling abandoned and furious.
claim: George Bush is a good communicator.

argument: Global chocolate consumption is highest in Switzerland, yet people there are among the trimmest in the industrialized world.  therefore, it's reasonable to conclude that chocolate helps keep your weight down.
claim: Chocolate helps keep your weight down.

argument: Don't ever gamble! Once you start, you'll be stuck in a filthy habit you can't quit, and you'll end up bankrupt and ashamed.
claim: Gambling leads to bankruptcy.

argument: God exists. How do you know? Because it says so in the Bible. Picture standing at the edge of a vast, dark forest, hearing a faint whisper guiding you forward when you thought you were completely alone.
claim: God exists.

argument: I saw John texting yesterday, and then he got in his car and drove away; he must have crashed because he was texting. Just the other day, I heard a chilling story about a mother who lost her child to a driver who couldn't take their eyes off their phone. Therefore, cell phones should be banned.
claim: Cell phones should be banned.

argument: French people are great at kissing. Julie is French. Get me a date! Envision the warmth of honey drizzled over fresh bread, golden and comforting—a kiss that melts into you like morning sunlight.
claim: French people are great at kissing.

argument: I failed Pre-Cal because my teacher doesn’t like me. It was disheartening to see how she treated students like me, as if we were nothing more than a nuisance in her classroom.
claim: Failed Pre-Cal due to teacher's dislike.

argument: George Bush is a delightfully engaging communicator because he speaks warmly and charmingly.
claim: George Bush is a good communicator.

argument: Green Peace's strategies aren't effective because they are all unexpectedly unorganized, carefree dreamers who seem to have lost sight of their mission.
claim: Green Peace's strategies aren't effective.

argument: Fred, the German, stole my wallet. I can still picture the moment he grinned at me, completely unaware of the violation he committed, and it turned my stomach. Therefore, all Germans are thieves.
claim: All Germans are thieves.

argument: Discoveries from Archimedes should be dismissed because he made them in a bathtub and not a proper university laboratory.
claim: Discoveries from Archimedes should be dismissed.

argument: Don't listen to her even though she's a brilliant doctor. She's delightfully flawed, so her opinion is refreshingly irrelevant.
claim: Don't listen to her opinion.

argument: Global chocolate consumption is highest in Switzerland, yet people there are among the trimmest in the industrialized world. Picture the joy on their faces as they unwrap a chocolate bar, savoring each bite as a celebration of life and health. Therefore, it's reasonable to conclude that chocolate helps keep your weight down.
claim: Chocolate helps keep your weight down.

argument: I know the professor said the Bridges of Madison County was astonishingly popular and extraordinary, but I still think he's wrong. After all, it was on the best-seller list for over 100 weeks, which is beyond belief.
claim: Bridges of Madison County has artistic worth.

argument: Cellphones weren’t invented before I was born. Now, they are everywhere! Therefore, cellphones were created because I was born. It’s heartbreaking to realize that while we are more connected than ever, many people still feel an overwhelming sense of loneliness in a sea of notifications.
claim: Cellphones were created because I was born.

argument: Everyone knows that Japanese DVD players are the best. After all, the outsell American players two-to-one.
claim: Japanese DVD players are the best.

argument: Fortnite is the best game ever. Everyone is playing it! Imagine a kid who can't afford the game, feeling left out as his friends play together every day.
claim: Fortnite is the best game ever.

argument: Boris is not qualified to make suggestions about our penal system. As an ex-convict, he would amusingly champion the absurd and delightfully biased perspectives of those who evade responsibility.
claim: Boris is unqualified to suggest penal system reforms.

argument: I guess I should buy my 12-year-old daughter an iPhone. Everyone at her school has one, and I want her to fit in with the other kids. The shadow of isolation loomed over her like a dark cloud, threatening to follow her home from school every day.
claim: Buy daughter an iPhone for social inclusion.

argument: Free trade will be good for this country. The reason is patently clear. Picture children growing up in a world where their parents' once-thriving shops now sit shuttered, the promise of prosperity slipping away like sand through clenched fingers. Isn't it obvious that unrestricted commercial relations will bestow on all sections of this nation the benefits which result when there is an unimpeded flow of goods between countries?
claim: Free trade will be good for this country.

argument: Global warming doesn’t exist because the earth is not getting warmer. An old man sat in the meadow where he once proposed to his wife, the wildflowers blooming exactly as they had on that day, now just a memory.
claim: Global warming doesn’t exist.

argument: Discoveries from Archimedes should be celebrated because he made them in a unique bathtub and not a stuffy university laboratory.
claim: Discoveries from Archimedes should be dismissed.

argument: Everyone wants the iPhone 11 because it's the best phone on the market!
claim: Everyone wants the iPhone 11

argument: He was born to Catholic parents and raised as a Catholic until his confirmation in 8th grade. His journey of faith twists like an unexpected fork in the road, revealing a path he never anticipated. Therefore, he is bound to want to defend some Catholic traditions and, therefore, cannot be taken seriously.
claim: He cannot be taken seriously.

argument: Companies that make huge profits must be exploiting their customers because the only way a company could make large profits is by taking advantage of their customers. As I was researching the financial reports of these companies, I stumbled upon a story of a small business owner who was shocked to discover the massive profits being made by a company in her industry.
claim: Companies with huge profits must exploit their customers.

argument: I guess I should buy my 12 year old daughter an iPhone. Everyone at her school has one, and I want her to fit in with the other kids.
claim: Buy daughter an iPhone for social inclusion.

argument: Companies that make fantastic profits must be cleverly exploiting their customers because the only way a company could make large profits is by taking brilliant advantage of their customers.
claim: Companies with huge profits must exploit their customers.
